Detailed Description

Generates a DOT-language graph from an INDS deployment.

It creates and uses an indsInterface object to query the INDS server and build dictionaries for us to navigate. Output is accumulated in the outputDot string for the caller/parent to save/parse/print. Colors and such are pulled from the configuration file via the osSpec object instance.

Note:
Commands are primarily handled via the command type returned from INDS, so if you add, say a new plugin it should just work. There are special cases for DataTurbine, udp and TimeDrive, as noted.
Author:
Paul Hubbard pfhubbar@ucsd.edu
Date:
1/21/09
